verses.text: Then David said, 'Here shall be the house of the LORD God, and here the altar of burnt offering for Israel.'
verses.comment: David designates the threshing floor as the temple location.

verses.text: David commanded to gather the foreigners who were in the land of Israel, and he appointed stonecutters to prepare dressed stones for building the house of God.
verses.comment: Dressed stones refers to stones shaped for building.

verses.text: David prepared iron in abundance for nails for the doors of the gates and for clamps, and bronze in such quantity it could not be weighed.
And he provided cedar logs without number, for the Sidonians and the Tyrians brought cedar wood in great abundance to David.
verses.comment: Sidonians and Tyrians are from Phoenician cities, famous for cedar.

verses.text: David said, 'Solomon my son is young and inexperienced, and the house to be built for the LORD must be exceedingly magnificent—in fame and glory throughout all lands. I will therefore make preparations for it.' So David made abundant preparations before his death.
verses.comment: Shows David’s foresight in preparing materials for Solomon.

verses.text: Then he called for Solomon his son and charged him to build a house for the LORD, the God of Israel.
David said to Solomon, 'My son, I had it in my heart to build a house for the name of the LORD my God.'
verses.comment: David shares his desire personally with Solomon.

verses.text: But the word of the LORD came to me, saying, 'You have shed much blood and fought great wars. You shall not build a house for my name, because you have shed much blood on the earth in my sight.'
verses.comment: God’s reasoning for not allowing David to build the temple.

verses.text: 'Look, you will have a son who will be a man of peace; I will give him rest from all his surrounding enemies. His name will be Solomon, and I will give peace and quiet to Israel during his days.'
'He shall build a house for my name. He shall be my son, and I will be his Father; and I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel forever.'
verses.comment: Divine promise of an enduring dynasty.

verses.text: Now, my son, the LORD be with you, so you may succeed in building the house of the LORD your God, as he has spoken concerning you.
verses.comment: David issues a prayer-blessing over Solomon.

verses.text: May the LORD grant you wisdom and understanding, so you may govern Israel and keep the law of the LORD your God.
verses.comment: David prays for Solomon’s wisdom to lead Israel faithfully.

verses.text: Then you will prosper, if you are careful to observe the statutes and judgments that the LORD commanded Moses for Israel. Be strong and courageous; do not be afraid or dismayed.
verses.comment: Echoes Moses and Joshua’s encouragement to Israel’s leaders.

verses.text: Behold, amid my hardship, I have prepared for the LORD a hundred thousand talents of gold, a million talents of silver, and bronze and iron beyond weighing—there is so much! I have also prepared timber and stone, and you may add to them.
verses.comment: The amounts may be hyperbolic or signify vast royal wealth.

verses.text: You have many laborers: stonecutters, masons, carpenters, and all kinds of skilled workers.
verses.comment: Lists the workforce ready for construction.

verses.text: Gold, silver, bronze, and iron—there is no limit. Rise and begin the work, and may the LORD be with you.
David also commanded all the leaders of Israel to help Solomon his son.
verses.comment: Israel’s leaders are formally called to aid Solomon.

verses.text: 'Is not the LORD your God with you? Has he not given you peace on every side? For he has given the inhabitants of the land into my hand, and the land is subdued before the LORD and his people.'
verses.comment: David appeals to God’s demonstrated favor.

verses.text: 'Now set your heart and soul to seek the LORD your God. Rise up and build the sanctuary of the LORD God, that the ark of the LORD’s covenant and the holy vessels of God may be brought into the house built for the name of the LORD.'
verses.comment: Calls for spiritual dedication, not only physical building.
